results.firPara: Wayne Rooney has compared José Mourinho to Sir Alex Ferguson, with Manchester Uniteds captain relishing working under the Portuguese as he did when the Scot managed the club.
results.secPara: Rooney said he joined United from Everton in summer 2004 because Ferguson was in charge and he won all but one of his major honours while playing for him. He believes Mourinho can have a similar impact on his career.
results.webTitle: Wayne Rooney sees parallels between José Mourinho and Sir Alex Ferguson

results.firPara: Bournemouths manager, Eddie Howe, has said he was not in the running for the England job and has given his backing to Sam Allardyce, who was formally appointed as manager on Friday.
results.secPara: Various national media reports had strongly linked Howe with the role, following Roy Hodgsons resignation as manager last month. The Football Association interviewed Allardyce and the former Hull City manager Steve Bruce for the job and is thought to have at least considered both Howe and Jürgen Klinsmann for the post.
results.webTitle: Bournemouth’s Eddie Howe says he was not in running for England job

results.firPara: Crystal Palace have offered £20m plus add-ons to sign Saido Berahino from West Bromwich Albion, bettering the £17m offer Stoke City submitted this week for the wantaway England Under-21 international. However West Brom are understood to have turned down both offers, with the chairman, Jeremy Peace, looking to hold out for an improved fee.
results.secPara: Stokes bid this week, confirmed by the Potters manager Mark Hughes, was understood to be £17m plus £3m in add-ons. Palace have offered a similar incentives on top of the £20m up front.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace submit bid of £20m for West Brom’s Saido Berahino

results.firPara: Liverpool have signed the 39-year-old former Arsenal goalkeeper Alex Manninger to provide cover for Loris Karius and Simon Mignolet next season.
results.secPara: Manninger has been training at Melwood for the past few weeks and accompanied Jürgen Klopps squad on their pre-season tour of the United States, which currently involves training at Stanford University before a friendly against Chelsea next Thursday.
results.webTitle: Liverpool sign former Arsenal goalkeeper Alex Manninger

results.firPara: • Holland international becomes seventh signing of summer at Anfield
results.secPara: Liverpool have completed the £25m signing of Georginio Wijnaldum from Newcastle United. The 25-year-old becomes Jürgen Klopps seventh newcomer of the summer, following the moves of Loris Karius, Joel Matip, Marko Grujic, Sadio Mané, Ragnar Klavan and Alex Manninger to Anfield.
results.webTitle: Liverpool seal £25m deal for Newcastle’s Georginio Wijnaldum

results.firPara: After leaving Preston, 34-year-old Allardyce – nicknamed Super Sam Bionic Man during his Bolton career – takes a player-coach role with West Brom. It ends in a mess – manager Brian Talbot and Allardyce both sacked in January 1991 after a red-faced 4–2 FA Cup defeat to Isthmian League side Woking. But Allardyces self-belief isnt shaken he moves to Bury as a part-time coach, before being handed his first big management chance in Ireland.
results.secPara: Allardyce is unveiled by Limerick. Its an eye-catching season he leads them straight to the second-tier title, and earns a coaching job back in England with Preston. Ten games later he becomes Prestons caretaker manager when Lee Chapman is sacked – but misses out on the full-time job to John Beck. Hes then tasked with instilling Becks brand of long-ball football in the youth team instead. He later details the experience in his autobiography It was ludicrous … I told the lads they had to do what the manager wanted, and placate the parents who threatened to take their sons to other clubs. It was hard defending the indefensible. I was in the dressing room telling them Target those corners, hook it on when youve got your back to goal. How did I feel? Shit.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce – the story so far: glory, bust-ups, and baiting José Mourinho

results.firPara: Today Still Bernard Cribbins, Big Sam, Norwich and universal enjoyment
results.secPara: Today Still Bernard Cribbins, Big Sam, Norwich and universal enjoyment
results.webTitle: Two men who drink gravy by the pint

results.firPara: With Sam Allardyce finally confirmed as the new England manager, heres what readers have to say on the appointment
results.secPara: With Sam Allardyce finally confirmed as the new England manager, heres what readers have to say on the appointment
results.webTitle: 'Good luck Big Sam' - readers react to the appointment of Sam Allardyce

results.firPara: Sam Allardyces first act as Englands new manager was to inform his players that the time has come to deliver.
results.secPara: After Sunderland finally agreed a £3m compensation deal with the Football Association on Friday afternoon, Roy Hodgsons successor made it clear he could not wait to set about the business of making the whole country proud.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce appointed England manager and says: ‘It’s time to deliver’

results.firPara: As the arch winner José Mourinho will be disappointed with this defeat, though a game played in stifling heat was never really about the result.
results.secPara: The Manchester United manager said beforehand the priority was for his new team to start the process of gelling, with zero focus on the opposition. This opening International Champions Cup game was in part, therefore, an exercise in searching for clues regarding the Portugueses thinking.
results.webTitle: Manchester United begin China tour with defeat to Borussia Dortmund
